item.title: R to @quantymacro: like sometimes I get v curious about some topics like ooh why does ridge do this or what happens if I fit tree model this way or why do ppl do X in portfolio optimisation and I go deep into the rabbit hole but that happens extremely rarely like maybe once a year

item.title:
they say to be successful in this field you have to have innate curiosity about things but I think mine generally is quite low
even for things that are ‚Äúquant-adjacent‚Äù like brypto/AI/LLM Idk much abt them or curious enough
probs that‚Äôs why I‚Äôm not successful

item.title:
don‚Äôt worry guys they just fired the analyst responsible for -55% returns (it was me). from now on it‚Äôs upwards only. dont understand all the dunking when the guy is clearly more successful than the dunkers

item.title: trading is simple bro you just have to notice a market inefficiency and then quantify it and then convert it to expected returns and then your estimate covariance matrix and then jam in your risk and turnover constraints and then
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro

item.title: R to @quantymacro: ofc ppl like to prop up what they do (me included) to inflate their sense of importance but go outside your big cities and twitter and you‚Äôll realise that if you take out the money you‚Äôve made there‚Äôs nothing much left to you unfortunately. have a good weekend

item.title:
Idk much abt ‚ÄúSuper ratio‚Äù, but may I perhaps interest you in something called ‚ÄúMultivariate Linear Regression‚Äù? where you have multiple features as inputs & produce a single estimate of exp returns. also pls add ridge penalty.
follow me for more extremely advanced quant tips.
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description:
